title: John H. Boylan State Airport
text:
John H. Boylan State Airport is a state-owned public-use <a href="airport">airport</a> located three <a href="nautical%20mile">nautical mile</a>s (6 <a href="kilometre">km</a>) southeast of the <a href="central%20business%20district">central business district</a> of <a href="Island%20Pond%2C%20Vermont">Island Pond</a>, in <a href="Essex%20County%2C%20Vermont">Essex County, Vermont</a>, United States.
Facilities and aircraft.
The airport is named for <a href="John%20H.%20Boylan">John H. Boylan</a>, a political figure who served as <a href="President%20pro%20tempore%20of%20the%20Vermont%20State%20Senate">President pro tempore of the Vermont State Senate</a>. It covers an area of 188 <a href="acre">acre</a>s (76 <a href="hectare">ha</a>) at an <a href="elevation">elevation</a> of 1,194 feet (364 m) above <a href="mean%20sea%20level">mean sea level</a>. It has one <a href="runway">runway</a> designated 14/32 with a <a href="grass">turf</a> surface measuring 2,650 by 120 feet (808 x 37 m).
For the 12-month period ending August 11, 2010, the airport had 200 <a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a> aircraft operations, an average of 16 per month. At that time there were five aircraft based at this airport: 60% single-<a href="aircraft%20engine">engine</a> and 40% <a href="ultralight">ultralight</a>.
